title: How powerfull is Ezreal's gaunlet?
body: Title. How powerfull is it and how powerfull are its blasts  (in-lore of course)? I didn't come to any conclusion reading his new lore myself what are your thoughts?

replies.body:
The runes reforged login implied it has the Inspiration World Rune in it.

So there's that.

Gameplay runes have nothing to do with lore, as Sckatlocke said here:
https://twitter.com/LaurieGoulding/status/1037461151917850624
> Runes in the game? They are a shorthand for abilities, and powers - we haven't yet explored whether or not they exist as actual things in the lore, yet.
 
Besides, in Ezreal's color sotry he almost went unconcious destroying a rock:
> I ready my gauntlet and concentrate all my energy into the gem. I feel it drawing power from me. My vision blurs and the world seems to tilt as the gem fills with magic. The gauntlet pulses the blue of a clear sky.
> 
> I open my hand and a brilliant arc of golden light as wide as the tunnel bursts from my palm. The force of the blast staggers me, but I maintain my focus. The light blazes in a continuous glowing channel, gleaming brightly as it disintegrates everything in its path, leaving a precariously narrow gap. My favorite kind of gap! 

Meanwhile, just two World Rune were able to destroy 160 KM according some calculations. 
> The earth fell away beneath them, the bedrock itself seeming to retch and squeal, while the sky above them recoiled as if mortally wounded. They looked back upon the valley where the rival armies had stood, and beheld insanity—destruction on a scale so massive that it defied all physical sense. The buildings, the people, all were gone, and the ocean, once a day’s journey to the east, now rushed to meet them.

(the calculations were based in the "Day's journey" part)

That scathelocke comment is from before Ryze's cinematic.

Where it was shown he has claimed and hidden Destruction, Precision, Sorcery and Resolve within a Demacian petricite vault.

Furthermore he fainted because of his gauntlet which absorbs his own innate magical energy.

Nope. That comment was pretty recent, actually.

Game runes =/= World Runes.

The power of the gauntlet is amplified by emotions; usually sadness, usually {{item:3070}}s

As Gold Light already said, it was implied multiple times that the gauntlet increases or amplify the magic of theu ser. So while it takes a long time to recharge and Ezreal almost went unconcious when he used his ult, when the gauntlet was in the hand of an Ascended it probally was one of the most powerfull weapons in Runeterra, since Ascended have A BUNCH of magic. If it was in the hands of powerfull mage like Ryze or Syndra, it would be really powerfull too.
>"Breathing hard, Ezreal looked down at the gauntlet as it hummed along with his heartbeat. **He could feel it siphoning and amplifying his own essence. **"

> "I activate my gauntlet, charging it with magical energy."

> "I ready my gauntlet and concentrate all my energy into the gem. I feel it drawing power from me. My vision blurs and the world seems to tilt as the gem fills with magic."

Wait did you just copy and paste my comment
lol

Strong enough to effortlessly blow up an ancient stone door and defeat a giant fire golem. I seem to recall, though, that its main purpose is amplifying one's own already-existing power, so I feel like it would vary from user to user.

Something to note, it may be possible while it amplifies {{champion:81}}'s magic, in the hands of someone more powerful, the feeling of 'amplification' may be less. 

If we assume Ne'zuk were an Ascended warrior or someone of substantial magical prowess compared to Ez (who is a regular human), Ez might notice a greater jump in power compared to when someone more magically inclined wears it, and not necessarily that the gauntlet simply amplifies the 'User's' power level.
